nodes.html: to all the registered members of the DPJ community

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: The primary responsibilities of a member of the DPJ Editorial Board are to:

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: • discuss and make decisions on diverse DPJ policy issues,

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: • serve as Managing Editors for submitted manuscripts,

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: • introduce new initiatives and policies to improve the DPJ,

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: • raise concerns about our current practice and its goals and values, and

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: • participate in the nominations and elections of the DPJ officers.

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: We expect serious commitment from the DPJ Editorial Board members to the above tasks. We look forward to working with you to shape DPJ editorial policies and provide your knowledge, expertise, and guidance to the authors and reviewers.

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: If interested in serving on the Editorial Board, please fill out the Google form of self-appointment to the 2024 Editorial Board, even if you are a current member of the DPJ Editorial Board.

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: Google form of self-appointment to the 2024 Editorial Board

nodes.html: Please send your self-appointment to the DPJ Editorial Board by March 1, 2024! At that time, we will assemble a new DPJ Editorial Board 2024, including all who want to commit to serving.
